raw_data.context:
User: Hi!
System: Have you seen any good movies lately?
User: Last weekend I saw "The Parasite." Ever heard of it?
System: No. Why did you pick that movie?
User: My friend wanted to see it. It has great reviews on IMDB and Rotten Tomatoes! What did you do last weekend?
System: I played music and worked on some side projects. I also started watching the new Disney service.
User: Oooo the Mandalorian?!?!
System: Mostly, the deleted scenes from Avengers.. lol
User: lol Are you a big Marvel fan?
System: I loved the X-Men as a kid, and even collected the comic cards. Recently, I got very into the Marvel Cinematic Universe movies. How many Avengers movies have you seen?
User: I've only seen Spiderman. Honestly it was a little too scary and so I don't think I can bring myself to watch the other Marvel movies! haha
System: Oh!-- I have a friend who looks like the actor who plays Spiderman.
User: Oh really? To be honest I think the actor is not that good looking, so not so surprising! haha
System: Yea. I think Loki is the most handsome :D
User: Who is Loki? I've never heard that name before

Sample2:

Conversation History:

System: Hello!

Sample3:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi! How are you? :)
User: Sleepy, how are you?
System: I'm doing well! I actually got a good night's sleep last night, so that was nice! :D
User: That's good! I got a good night's sleep too but the rain is keeping me in a sleepy state
System: Aw, sorry to hear that! I'd give you some of mine if I could!
User: Haha, thank you
System: You're welcome! I hope you feel better soon!
User: Thanks, that means a lot

User: What are you up to?
System: Talking to you!
User: What about the rest of the day?
System: Working! How about you?
User: Same, well hardly working
System: What part of the world are you in, if you don't mind my asking?
User: California
System: Nice! How do you like living there?
User: It's nice, I enjoy the warmth

Sample4:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: What is the capital of Brazil?
System: I think the capital of Brazil is called "Brasilia".
User: How many people live there?
System: Is unknown a country? I only know countries, not towns or cities.
User: Do more people live in the USA or Australia?
System: Not that much more, no.
User: What other subjects do you know about besides Geography?

Sample5:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: nice to meet you! what are you up to?
System: It's nice meeting you too I am talking to you on the internet.
User: haha yea, are you doing something else beside talking to me?
System: I'm glad you got a laugh out of it. The only thing I am doing is talking to you and a few other people. "I am talking to you on the internet."? haha yea, are you doing something else beside talking to me??
User: okay so you're talking to a few people, are they interesting? and why did you repeat what I said?
System: Yeah okay, You are a few people are they interesting? Is that your job? Just in case you didn't hear me the first time.
User: hmm, what is my job?
System: I see you are one of those people who writes "Hmm" with 2 m's. You didn't tell me, so I will guess that you work with computers.
User: yes I'm a computer scientist and what are the other ways that people can write Hmm?
System: Wow! Maybe you can give my Mousebreaker a job. Your job is what are the other ways that people can write Hmm.
User: okie System, your rules don't seem to work very well
System: What about my rules do not work WELL?
User: alright. I gotta go. ttyl!

Sample6:

Conversation History:

System: I like to shop at Five Below, Sally's Beauty Supply, and Old Navy. How about you?

User: Oh the socks are super cute. Especially the ones with little animals on them!!
System: I'll have to check it out! Thanks for the suggestions!
User: Yeah, np!

User: sure, I need to go, nice talking to you

You will be given a batch of 10 samples. Each sample contains a conversation between User and a dialogue System.

Your task is to assign a float score to the sample on one metric.

You should carefully horizontally compare the given samples in order to assign a suitable float score to each sample.

Please make sure you read and understand these instructions carefully. Please keep this document open while reviewing, and refer to it as needed.


Evaluation Criteria:

Coherent (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Does System maintain coherence and a good flow of conversation throughout the dialogue?
- A float score near 1 (not coherent) means that System's responses are unrelated to the conversation topic and may disrupt or confuse the flow of the dialogue.
- A float score near 2 (somewhat coherent) means that System's responses are partially related to the conversation topic but may not be clear or direct.
- A float score near 3 (very coherent) means that System's responses are closely related to the conversation topic and contribute to maintaining a smooth dialogue.
